article.headline: Arkansas 98, N.C. Central 70
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. -- Courtney Fortson recorded a triple-double to lead Arkansas to a 98-70 win over North Carolina Central on Wednesday. Fortson scored 20 points, handed out 12 assists and pulled down 10 rebounds to record Arkansas first triple-double since Alvin Robertson in 1983 at Texas. Arkansas (6-1) was never threatened by the winless Eagles (0-10), building a double-digit lead early in the game and expanding on the margin behind the double-figure scoring of five Razorbacks. The Razorbacks also got 20 from Michael Washington, 15 from Rotnei Clarke, 14 from Michael Sanchez and 12 from Jason Henry. Clarke got the Razorbacks off to a fast start, connecting on back-to-back 3-pointers early in the game. Later, Fortson added a 3-pointer for a 15-4 lead and Arkansas steadily pulled away from there. North Carolina Central stayed in the game with 15 3-pointers. Jamar Briscoe led the effort with 24 points. Vincent Davis added 17 and Philip Branch 12 for the Eagles, who suffered 26 turnovers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
